metadata.title: CASE 462/04: Investigation into Allegations of Bribery and Favouritism in Procurement by Pristina Airport

overview: This document details an investigation conducted by the UNMIK Investigation Task Force into allegations of procurement irregularities at Pristina Airport, involving bribery and favoritism.

applicable_laws.excerpt: Avoidance of Conflicts of Interest and Corruption
Public Procurement Using Kosovo Consolidated Budget Funds

methodology.description: Investigation commenced following an internal audit memo and involved reviewing complaint letters and interviewing involved parties.
documents_reviewed: Letter of complaint from Vendor 1 Manager

background.context: The investigation was triggered by a memorandum from the Internal Audit Unit of the Kosovo Trust Agency highlighting anomalies in the uniform procurement process at Pristina Airport.

investigation_details.subject: Allegations of Bribery and Favoritism in the Procurement Process at Pristina Airport

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 and Finance Officer allegedly accepted bribes from Vendor 2.
allegations.findings: The ITF did not find any evidence to support the allegation that Procurement Officer 1 and/or the Finance Officer accepted bribes from Vendor 2. The allegation is unsubstantiated.

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 replaced a Bid Evaluation Committee member.
allegations.findings: The rationale for replacing the member is reasonable. The replacement was not made for any questionable purpose.

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 included Finance Officer inappropriately in the Bid Evaluation Committee.
allegations.findings: The Finance Officer participated but there was no regulation precluding finance personnel from attendance. The allegation is unsubstantiated.

allegations.description: Procurement Officer 1 favored Vendor 2 in the tender process.
allegations.findings: No evidence was found to support this claim. The investigation determined that the proceeding's management was fair and objective, thus the allegation is unsubstantiated.
Vendor 1 Manager confirmed he/she told Procurement Officer 1 about going to higher levels or court but denied any physical threat. Allegations of intimidation were not substantiated.

findings: Allegations of bribery, improper committee membership, tender process favoritism, and threats largely unsubstantiated.
Document suggests improved internal controls and third-party audits might prevent future occurrences.

actions: Inform Procurement Officer 1 and Finance Officer that no wrongdoing was found. (IV04/462/01)
Provide the report to the Department of Justice and the Financial Investigation Unit for use in current investigations. (IV04/462/02)
